channel.title: Comments on: JSON Does Not Require eval( )

item.title: By: Matt Westcott
item.dc:creator: Matt Westcott
item.description: It's neat that the Yahoo API gives you this shortcut, but I don't see why it makes you any less nervous than using eval() directly. By putting a Yahoo URL in your script src="..." attribute, you're still blindly executing whatever code Yahoo decide to send back, and trusting them not to do anything evil.

item.title: By: Kalle Kasurila
item.dc:creator: Kalle Kasurila
item.description: Your website doesn't define a default text color, but sets the bg color in many places. As my default text color is white, this results in white-on-white text in many places. Please add 'color: #000000;' to the body-element (or whatever-the-white-areas-are) in your css. You shouldn't trust the user to have sensible defaults :)
